titleStmt.title: William Spears and James McGough v. King County. Orginial Verdict.

bibl.title: William Spears and James McGough v King County. Original Verdict.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: James Seavey James Fleass Bernance McCroary

div1.ab: In Justice's Court, before T.H. Cann, Justice of the Peace.
Territory of Washington, County of King |ss.
To any Constable, and the Keeper of the Jail of said County:
div1.p: Whereas Wm Spears. James t McGough of King has been brought this day before the undersigned, one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said county, charged on the Bernance McCroary with having on the 26 day of October 1883, in said county, committed the offense of obtaining money by false Pretense and in the progress of the trial of said charge, it appearing to the said magistrate that the said Spears + McGough has been guilty of the offense of obtaining money under a false pretense committed at the time and place aforesaid; and
Whereas, the daid defendants has failed to give bail in the sum of two hundred dollars for his appearance to answer at the next term of the District Court, as required by me.

Therefore, you, the said Sheriff in the name of the United States, forthwith to convey and deliver the said defendants to the said Keeper; and you, the said Keeper, are, hereby commanded to receieve the said Defendants into your custody in said Jail, and him there safely keep until the next term of the District Court, holding terms at Seattle, King C County W.T. or until he shall be discharged by due course of law.
div1.ab: Dated this the 9 day of November 1883
T.H. Cann Justice of the Peace in and for King County, W.T.
No. In the Matter of the Application of William Spears and James McGough for Writ of Habeas Corpus Wirt and Return Filed Nov. 9th 1883 James Seavey, Clerk. By James Fleass Deputy Clerk.
